de.thesycon.usbio
Class UsbIo

java.lang.Object
  de.thesycon.usbio.UsbIo
All Implemented Interfaces:
UsbIoErrorCodes, UsbIoInterface, UsbSpec
Direct Known Subclasses:
UsbIoPipe
public class UsbIo
extends java.lang.Object
implements UsbIoErrorCodes, UsbIoInterface, UsbSpec

This class implements the interface to the USBIO device driver. It contains only general device-related functions that can be executed without a pipe context. Pipe specific functions are implemented by the UsbIoPipe class.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Thesycon

Constructor Detail

UsbIo

public UsbIo()
Standard constructor of the UsbIo class.

open(int, int, String)
Method Detail

createDeviceList

public static int createDeviceList(java.lang.String InterfaceGuid)
Creates an internal device list.

The function creates a windows-internal device list that contains all matching interfaces. The device interface is identified by InterfaceGuid. A handle for the list is returned in case of success, or 0 is returned in case of error. The device list can be iterated by means of Open.

The device list returned must be freed by a call to DestroyDeviceList.

Note that CreateDeviceList is declared static. It can be used independently of class instances.

Parameters:
InterfaceGuid - This is the predefined interface GUID of the USBIO device driver or a user defined GUID which must be inserted in the USBIO.INF file.
Returns:
Returns a handle to the device list if successful, or 0 otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), destroyDeviceList(int)

destroyDeviceList

public static void destroyDeviceList(int DeviceList)
Destroy the internal device list.

Use this function to destroy a device list that was generated by a call to CreateDeviceList.

Note that DestroyDeviceList is declared static. It can be used independently of class instances.

Parameters:
DeviceList - A handle to a device list returned by CreateDeviceList.
See Also:
createDeviceList(String)

errorText

public static java.lang.String errorText(int ErrorCode)
Translate an USBIO error code to a description string.

This function supports private USBIO error codes only. These codes start with a prefix of 0xE. The function cannot be used to translate general Windows error codes.

Note that ErrorText is declared static. It can be used independently of class instances.

Parameters:
ErrorCode - The error code to be translated.
Returns:
The function returns a String with the error text.

isOpen

public boolean isOpen()
Returns true if the class instance is attached to a device.

Returns:
true if the class instance is attached to a device, false otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), close()

isOperatingAtHighSpeed

public boolean isOperatingAtHighSpeed()
Returns true if the USB 2.0 device is operating at high speed (480 Mbit/s).

If this function returns true then the USB device operates in high speed mode. The USB 2.0 device is connected to a hub port that is high speed capable.

Note that this function does not indicate whether a device is capable of high speed operation, but rather whether it is in fact operating at high speed.

This function calls getDeviceInfo to get the requested information.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

Returns:
true if the USB device is operating at high speed, false otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), getDeviceInfo(USBIO_DEVICE_INFO)

isCheckedBuild

public boolean isCheckedBuild()
Returns true if a checked build (debug version) of the USBIO driver was detected.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

Returns:
true if the checked build of the USBIO driver is running, false otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), isDemoVersion(), isLightVersion()

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

Returns:
true if the Demo version of the USBIO driver is running, false otherwise.
See Also:

open

public int open(int DeviceNumber,
                int DeviceList,
                java.lang.String InterfaceGuid)
Open an USB device.

Parameters:
DeviceNumber - Specifies the index number of the USB Device. The index is zero-based. Note that the association between this number and the USB device can change with each call to CreateDeviceList.
DeviceList - A handle to the internal device list which was returned by the function CreateDeviceList or 0.
InterfaceGuid - The specified GUID is the predefined interface GUID of the USBIO device driver, or a user-defined GUID which has to be defined in the USBIO.INF file. This parameter will be ignored if DeviceList is set to NULL. For more information, see below.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
createDeviceList(String), destroyDeviceList(int), close(), isOpen(), isCheckedBuild(), isDemoVersion(), isLightVersion()

close

public void close()
Close the USB device.

This function can be called if the device is not open. It does nothing in this case.

Any thread associated with the class instance should have been stopped before this function is called. See shutdownThread.

See Also:
createDeviceList(String), destroyDeviceList(int), open(int, int, String), UsbIoThread.shutdownThread()

acquireDevice

public int acquireDevice()
Acquire the USB device for exclusive use.

If the function returns with success, no other process can open the same device.

See Also:
open(int, int, String), releaseDevice()

releaseDevice

public int releaseDevice()
Release the USB device.

If the function returns with success, other processes can open the device.

See Also:
open(int, int, String), acquireDevice()

getBandwidthInfo

public int getBandwidthInfo(USBIO_BANDWIDTH_INFO BandwidthInfo)
Get information on the current USB bandwidth consumption.

The function enables an application to check the bandwidth that is available on the USB. Depending on this information an application can select an appropriate device configuration, if desired.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_GET_BANDWIDTH_INFO operation.

Parameters:
BandwidthInfo - Reference to a caller-provided variable. The structure returns information on the bandwidth that is available on the USB.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), USBIO_BANDWIDTH_INFO.USBIO_BANDWIDTH_INFO()

getDeviceInfo

public int getDeviceInfo(USBIO_DEVICE_INFO DeviceInfo)
Get information about the USB device.

This function can be used to detect if the device operates in high speed mode.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_GET_DEVICE_INFO operation.

Parameters:
DeviceInfo - Reference to a caller-provided variable. The structure returns information on the USB device. This includes a flag that indicates whether the device operates in high speed mode or not.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), USBIO_DEVICE_INFO.USBIO_DEVICE_INFO()

classOrVendorInRequest

public int classOrVendorInRequest(USBIO_DATA_BUFFER BufDesc,
                                  USBIO_CLASS_OR_VENDOR_REQUEST Request)
Sends a class or vendor specific request with a data phase in device to host (IN) direction.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_CLASS_OR_VENDOR_IN_REQUEST operation.

Parameters:
BufDesc - Reference to a caller-provided buffer descriptor. The buffer receives the data transferred in the IN data phase. When the function is called the buffer descriptor specifies the size, in bytes, of the buffer. After the function successfully returned the buffer descriptor contains the number of valid bytes returned in the buffer.
Request - Reference to a caller-provided variable that defines the request to be generated.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), classOrVendorOutRequest(USBIO_DATA_BUFFER, USBIO_CLASS_OR_VENDOR_REQUEST), USBIO_CLASS_OR_VENDOR_REQUEST.USBIO_CLASS_OR_VENDOR_REQUEST()

classOrVendorOutRequest

public int classOrVendorOutRequest(USBIO_DATA_BUFFER BufDesc,
                                   USBIO_CLASS_OR_VENDOR_REQUEST Request)
Sends a class or vendor specific request with a data phase in host to device (OUT) direction.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_CLASS_OR_VENDOR_OUT_REQUEST operation.

Parameters:
BufDesc - Reference to a caller-provided buffer descriptor. The buffer receives the data transferred in the IN data phase. When the function is called the buffer descriptor specifies the size, in bytes, of the buffer. After the function successfully returned the buffer descriptor contains the number of bytes transferred.
Request - Reference to a caller-provided variable that defines the request to be generated.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), classOrVendorInRequest(USBIO_DATA_BUFFER, USBIO_CLASS_OR_VENDOR_REQUEST), USBIO_CLASS_OR_VENDOR_REQUEST.USBIO_CLASS_OR_VENDOR_REQUEST()

cyclePort

public int cyclePort()
Simulates a device disconnect/connect cycle.

This function causes a device disconnect/connect cycle and an unload/load cycle for the USBIO device driver as well.

Note: CyclePort does not work on multi-interface devices (see also problems.txt in the USBIO package).

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_CYCLE_PORT operation.

Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), resetDevice()

resetDevice

public int resetDevice()
Force an USB reset.

This function causes an USB reset to be issued on the hub port the device is connected to. This will abort all pending read and write requests and unbind all pipes. The device will be set to the unconfigured state.

Note: The device must be in the configured state when this function is called. ResetDevice does not work when the system-provided USB multi-interface driver is used (see also problems.txt in the USBIO package).

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_RESET_DEVICE operation.

Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), setConfiguration(USBIO_SET_CONFIGURATION), unconfigureDevice(), cyclePort(), UsbIoPipe.bind(int, byte, int, String), UsbIoPipe.unbind(), UsbIoPipe.abortPipe()

getCurrentFrameNumber

public int getCurrentFrameNumber(int[] FrameNumber)
Get the current USB frame number from the host controller.

The returned frame number is a 32 bit value. The 11 least significant bits correspond to the frame number in the USB frame token.

The device must have been opened and configured before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_GET_CURRENT_FRAME_NUMBER operation.

Parameters:
FrameNumber - If the function call is successful this variable returns the current frame number.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String)

getStatus

public int getStatus(short[] StatusValue,
                     int Recipient,
                     short Index)
Send a get status request to the USB device.

The device must have been opened and configured before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_GET_STATUS operation.

Parameters:
StatusValue - If the function call is successful this variable returns the 16-bit value that is returned by the recipient in response to the get status request. The interpretation of the value is specific to the recipient. Refer to the USB specification.
Recipient - Specifies the recipient of the request.
Index - Specifies the index value for the get status request. The values are defined by the device. Refer to the USB specification.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), setFeature(int, short, short), clearFeature(int, short, short)

getInterface

public int getInterface(byte[] AlternateSetting,
                        short Interface)
This function returns the active alternate setting of an interface.

The device must have been opened and configured before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_GET_INTERFACE operation.

Parameters:
AlternateSetting - If the function call is successful this variable returns the current alternate setting of the interface.
Interface - Specifies the index of the interface to be queried.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), setConfiguration(USBIO_SET_CONFIGURATION), setInterface(USBIO_INTERFACE_SETTING)

setInterface

public int setInterface(USBIO_INTERFACE_SETTING InterfaceSetting)
This function changes the alternate setting of an interface.

The device must have been opened and configured before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_SET_INTERFACE operation.

Parameters:
InterfaceSetting - Reference to a caller-provided structure that specifies the interface and the alternate settings to be set.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), setConfiguration(USBIO_SET_CONFIGURATION), getInterface(byte[], short), USBIO_INTERFACE_SETTING.USBIO_INTERFACE_SETTING()

getDevicePowerState

public int getDevicePowerState(int[] DevicePowerState)
Returns the current device power state.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_GET_DEVICE_POWER_STATE operation.

Parameters:
DevicePowerState - If the function call is successful this variable returns the current device power state.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), setDevicePowerState(int)

setDevicePowerState

public int setDevicePowerState(int DevicePowerState)
Set the device power state.

In order to set the device to suspend it must be in the configured state.

When the device is set to suspend all pending read and write requests will be returned by the USBIO driver with an error status of USBIO_ERR_POWER_DOWN. An application can ignore this error status and submit the requests to the driver again.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_SET_DEVICE_POWER_STATE operation.

Parameters:
DevicePowerState - If the function call is successful this variable returns the current device power state.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), getDevicePowerState(int[])

clearFeature

public int clearFeature(int Recipient,
                        short FeatureSelector,
                        short Index)
Send a clear feature request to the USB device.

In order to set the device to suspend it must be in the configured state.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_CLEAR_FEATURE operation.

Parameters:
Recipient - Specifies the recipient of the request.
FeatureSelector - Specifies the feature selector value for the request. The values are defined by the recipient. Refer to the USB specification.
Index - Specifies the index value for the set feature request. The values are defined by the device. Refer to the USB specification.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), setFeature(int, short, short), getStatus(short[], int, short)

setFeature

public int setFeature(int Recipient,
                      short FeatureSelector,
                      short Index)
Send a set feature request to the USB device.

In order to set the device to suspend it must be in the configured state.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_SET_FEATURE operation.

Parameters:
Recipient - Specifies the recipient of the request.
FeatureSelector - Specifies the feature selector value for the request. The values are defined by the recipient. Refer to the USB specification.
Index - Specifies the index value for the set feature request. The values are defined by the device. Refer to the USB specification.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), clearFeature(int, short, short), getStatus(short[], int, short)

getDescriptor

public int getDescriptor(USBIO_DATA_BUFFER BufDesc,
                         int Recipient,
                         byte DescriptorType,
                         byte DescriptorIndex,
                         short LanguageId)
Get a descriptor from the device.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_GET_DESCRIPTOR operation.

Parameters:
BufDesc - Reference to a caller-provided buffer descriptor. The buffer receives the requested descriptor. When the function is called the buffer descriptor specifies the size, in bytes, of the buffer. After the function successfully returned the buffer descriptor contains the number of valid bytes returned in the buffer.
Recipient - Specifies the recipient of the request.
DescriptorType - The type of the descriptor to request.
DescriptorIndex - The index of the descriptor to request.
LanguageId - The language ID of the descriptor to request. Used for string descriptors only.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), getDeviceDescriptor(USB_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR), getConfigurationDescriptor(USBIO_DATA_BUFFER, byte), getStringDescriptor(USB_STRING_DESCRIPTOR, byte, int), setDescriptor(USBIO_DATA_BUFFER, int, byte, byte, short)

                         byte DescriptorType,
                         byte DescriptorIndex)

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

When the function is called the buffer descriptor specifies the size, in bytes, of the buffer. After the function successfully returned the buffer descriptor contains the number of valid bytes returned in the buffer.
Recipient - Specifies the recipient of the request.
DescriptorType - The type of the descriptor to request.
DescriptorIndex - The index of the descriptor to request.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:

setDescriptor

public int setDescriptor(USBIO_DATA_BUFFER BufDesc,
                         int Recipient,
                         byte DescriptorType,
                         byte DescriptorIndex,
                         short LanguageId)
Set a descriptor of the device.

Note that most devices do not support the set descriptor request.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_SET_DESCRIPTOR operation.

Parameters:
BufDesc - Reference to a caller-provided buffer descriptor. The buffer contains the descriptor data to be set. When the function is called the buffer descriptor specifies the size, in bytes, of the buffer. After the function successfully returned the buffer descriptor contains the number of bytes transferred.
Recipient - Specifies the recipient of the request.
DescriptorType - The type of the descriptor to set.
DescriptorIndex - The index of the descriptor to set.
LanguageId - The language ID of the descriptor to set. Used for string descriptors only.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), getDescriptor(USBIO_DATA_BUFFER, int, byte, byte), getDeviceDescriptor(USB_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR), getConfigurationDescriptor(USBIO_DATA_BUFFER, byte), getStringDescriptor(USB_STRING_DESCRIPTOR, byte, int)

getStringDescriptor

public int getStringDescriptor(USB_STRING_DESCRIPTOR Desc,
                               byte Index,
                               int LanguageId)
Get a string descriptor from the device.

GetStringDescriptor calls GetDescriptor to retrieve the descriptor. Thus, for detailed information see also GetDescriptor.

If this function is called with Index set to 0 the device returns a list of language IDs it supports. An application can select the correct language ID and use it in subsequent calls to this function.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

Parameters:
Desc - Reference to a caller-provided buffer that receives the requested descriptor. Note that according to the USB specification the maximum size of a string descriptor is 256 bytes.
Index - The index of the descriptor to request. Set to 0 to retrieve a list of supported language IDs.
LanguageId - The language ID of the string descriptor to request.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), getDescriptor(USBIO_DATA_BUFFER, int, byte, byte), getConfigurationDescriptor(USBIO_DATA_BUFFER, byte), getDeviceDescriptor(USB_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR)

getConfigurationDescriptor

public int getConfigurationDescriptor(USBIO_DATA_BUFFER BufDesc,
                                      byte Index)
Get a configuration descriptor from the device.

GetConfigurationDescriptor calls GetDescriptor to retrieve the descriptor. Thus, for detailed information see also GetDescriptor.

If the total size of the configuration descriptor is not known it can be retrieved in a two step process. With a first call to this function the fixed part of the descriptor which is defined by USB_CONFIGURATION_DESCRIPTOR is retrieved. The total size of the descriptor is indicated by the wTotalLength field of the structure. In a second step a buffer of the required size can be allocated and the complete descriptor can be retrieved with another call to this function.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

Parameters:
BufDesc - Reference to a caller-provided buffer descriptor that receives the requested descriptor. Note that the size of the configuration descriptor depends on the USB device. See also the comments below. When the function is called the buffer descriptor specifies the size, in bytes, of the buffer. After the function successfully returned the buffer descriptor contains the number of valid bytes returned in the buffer.
Index - The index of the descriptor to request.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), getDescriptor(USBIO_DATA_BUFFER, int, byte, byte), getStringDescriptor(USB_STRING_DESCRIPTOR, byte, int), getDeviceDescriptor(USB_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR)

getConfiguration

public int getConfiguration(byte[] ConfigurationValue)
This function returns the current configuration value.

The configuration value returned by this function corresponds to the bConfiguration field of the active configuration descriptor. Note that the configuration value does not necessarily correspond to the index of the configuration descriptor.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_GET_CONFIGURATION operation.

Parameters:
ConfigurationValue - If the function call is successful this variable returns the current configuration value. A value of 0 means the USB device is not configured.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), setConfiguration(USBIO_SET_CONFIGURATION)

getConfigurationInfo

public int getConfigurationInfo(USBIO_CONFIGURATION_INFO ConfigurationInfo)
Get information on the interfaces and endpoints available in the current configuration.

The information returned is retrieved from the USBIO driver's internal data base. This function does not cause any action on the USB.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

Parameters:
ConfigurationInfo - Reference to a caller-provided variable that receives the configuration information.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), setConfiguration(USBIO_SET_CONFIGURATION), USBIO_CONFIGURATION_INFO.USBIO_CONFIGURATION_INFO()

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_GET_DEVICE_PARAMETERS operation.

Parameters:
DevParam - Reference to a caller-provided variable that receives the current parameter settings.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), setDeviceParameters(USBIO_DEVICE_PARAMETERS), USBIO_DEVICE_PARAMETERS.USBIO_DEVICE_PARAMETERS()

setDeviceParameters

public int setDeviceParameters(USBIO_DEVICE_PARAMETERS DevParam)
Set device-related parameters in the USBIO device driver.

Default device parameters are stored in the registry during USBIO driver installation. The default value can be changed in the INF file or in the registry. Device parameters set by means of this function are valid until the device is removed from the PC or the PC is booted. A modification during run-time does not change the default in the registry.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_SET_DEVICE_PARAMETERS operation.

Parameters:
DevParam - Reference to a caller-provided variable that receives the current parameter settings.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), getDeviceDescriptor(USB_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR), USBIO_DEVICE_PARAMETERS.USBIO_DEVICE_PARAMETERS()

getDriverInfo

public int getDriverInfo(USBIO_DRIVER_INFO DriverInfo)
Get information on the USBIO device driver.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_GET_DRIVER_INFO operation.

Parameters:
DriverInfo - Reference to a caller-provided variable. The structure returns the API version, the driver version, and the build number.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), close(), USBIO_DRIVER_INFO.USBIO_DRIVER_INFO()

setConfiguration

public int setConfiguration(USBIO_SET_CONFIGURATION Conf)
Set the device to the configured state.

The device has to be configured before any data transfer from or to its endpoints can take place. Only those endpoints that are included in the configuration will be activated and can be subsequently used for data transfers.

If the device provides more than one interface all interfaces must be configured in one call to this function.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_SET_CONFIGURATION operation.

Parameters:
Conf - Reference to a caller-provided buffer.
Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), unconfigureDevice(), getConfiguration(byte[]), setInterface(USBIO_INTERFACE_SETTING), USBIO_SET_CONFIGURATION.USBIO_SET_CONFIGURATION()

unconfigureDevice

public int unconfigureDevice()
Set the device to the unconfigured state.

The device must have been opened before this function is called.

This function is a wrapper for the IOCTL_USBIO_UNCONFIGURE_DEVICE operation.

Returns:
The function returns 0 if successful, an USBIO error code otherwise.
See Also:
open(int, int, String), setConfiguration(USBIO_SET_CONFIGURATION), getConfiguration(byte[])
